<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Utility to embed an integer into a pointer-like type. This is specifically</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// intended to allow embedding integers where fewer bits are required than</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// exist in a pointer, and the integer can participate in abstractions along</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// side other pointer-like types. For example it can be placed into a \\c</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// PointerSumType or \\c PointerUnion.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Note that much like pointers, an integer value of zero has special utility</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// due to boolean conversions. For example, a non-null value can be tested for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// in the above abstractions without testing the particular active member.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Also, the default constructed value zero initializes the integer.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> IntT, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Bits = sizeof(IntT) &#42; CHAR&#95;BIT&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointerembeddedint"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointerembeddedint/#ad6fb45970333ed1021fa68939785950d">PointerEmbeddedInt</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlight">  uintptr&#95;t Value = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Note: This &#39;&lt;&#39; is correct; using &#39;&lt;=&#39; would result in some shifts</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// overflowing their storage types.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointerembeddedint/#a4d120b8037d5e9933d98ff076edab2d8"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static&#95;assert</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(Bits &lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">sizeof</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(uintptr&#95;t) &#42; CHAR&#95;BIT,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlight">                </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Cannot embed more bits than we have in a pointer!&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlight">  enum : uintptr&#95;t &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We shift as many zeros into the value as we can while preserving the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// number of bits desired for the integer.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Shift = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">sizeof</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(uintptr&#95;t) &#42; CHAR&#95;BIT - Bits,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We also want to be able to mask out the preserved bits for asserts.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Mask = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static&#95;cast&lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">uintptr&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">&gt;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(-1) &lt;&lt; Bits</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight">RawValueTag &#123;</span></CodeLine>
